005package edu.wpi.first.networktables;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.util.WPIUtilJNI;
008import edu.wpi.first.util.concurrent.Event;
009import edu.wpi.first.util.datalog.DataLog;
010import java.util.HashMap;
011import java.util.Map;
012import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentHashMap;
013import java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentMap;
014import java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit;
015import java.util.concurrent.locks.Condition;
016import java.util.concurrent.locks.ReentrantLock;
017import java.util.function.Consumer;
018
019/**
020 * NetworkTables Instance.
021 *
022 * <p>Instances are completely independent from each other. Table operations on one instance will
023 * not be visible to other instances unless the instances are connected via the network. The main
024 * limitation on instances is that you cannot have two servers on the same network port. The main
025 * utility of instances is for unit testing, but they can also enable one program to connect to two
026 * different NetworkTables networks.
027 *
028 * <p>The global "default" instance (as returned by {@link #getDefault()}) is always available, and
029 * is intended for the common case when there is only a single NetworkTables instance being used in
030 * the program.
031 *
032 * <p>Additional instances can be created with the {@link #create()} function. A reference must be
033 * kept to the NetworkTableInstance returned by this function to keep it from being garbage
034 * collected.
035 */
036@SuppressWarnings("PMD.CouplingBetweenObjects")
037public final class NetworkTableInstance implements AutoCloseable {
038  /**
039   * Client/server mode flag values (as returned by {@link #getNetworkMode()}). This is a bitmask.
040   */
041  public static final int kNetModeNone = 0x00;
042
043  public static final int kNetModeServer = 0x01;
044  public static final int kNetModeClient3 = 0x02;
045  public static final int kNetModeClient4 = 0x04;
046  public static final int kNetModeStarting = 0x08;
047  public static final int kNetModeLocal = 0x10;
048
049  /** The default port that network tables operates on for NT3. */
050  public static final int kDefaultPort3 = 1735;
051
052  /** The default port that network tables operates on for NT4. */
053  public static final int kDefaultPort4 = 5810;
054
055  /**
056   * Construct from native handle.
057   *
058   * @param handle Native handle
059   */
060  private NetworkTableInstance(int handle) {
061    m_owned = false;
062    m_handle = handle;
063  }
064
065  /** Destroys the instance (if created by {@link #create()}). */
066  @Override
067  public synchronized void close() {
068    if (m_owned && m_handle != 0) {
069      m_listeners.close();
070      NetworkTablesJNI.destroyInstance(m_handle);
071    }
072  }
073
074  /**
075   * Determines if the native handle is valid.
076   *
077   * @return True if the native handle is valid, false otherwise.
078   */
079  public boolean isValid() {
080    return m_handle != 0;
081  }
082
083  /* The default instance. */
084  private static NetworkTableInstance s_defaultInstance;
085
086  /**
087   * Get global default instance.
088   *
089   * @return Global default instance
090   */
091  public static synchronized NetworkTableInstance getDefault() {
092    if (s_defaultInstance == null) {
093      s_defaultInstance = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.getDefaultInstance());
094    }
095    return s_defaultInstance;
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Create an instance. Note: A reference to the returned instance must be retained to ensure the
100   * instance is not garbage collected.
101   *
102   * @return Newly created instance
103   */
104  public static NetworkTableInstance create() {
105    NetworkTableInstance inst = new NetworkTableInstance(NetworkTablesJNI.createInstance());
106    inst.m_owned = true;
107    return inst;
108  }
109
110  /**
111   * Gets the native handle for the instance.
112   *
113   * @return Native handle
114   */
115  public int getHandle() {
116    return m_handle;
117  }
118
119  /**
120   * Get (generic) topic.
121   *
122   * @param name topic name
123   * @return Topic
124   */
125  public Topic getTopic(String name) {
126    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
127    if (topic == null) {
128      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
129      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
130      Topic oldTopic = m_topics.putIfAbsent(name, topic);
131      if (oldTopic != null) {
132        topic = oldTopic;
133      }
134      // also cache by handle
135      m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
136    }
137    return topic;
138  }
139
140  /**
141   * Get boolean topic.
142   *
143   * @param name topic name
144   * @return BooleanTopic
145   */
146  public BooleanTopic getBooleanTopic(String name) {
147    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
148    if (topic instanceof BooleanTopic) {
149      return (BooleanTopic) topic;
150    }
151
152    int handle;
153    if (topic == null) {
154      handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
155    } else {
156      handle = topic.getHandle();
157    }
158
159    topic = new BooleanTopic(this, handle);
160    m_topics.put(name, topic);
161
162    // also cache by handle
163    m_topicsByHandle.put(handle, topic);
164
165    return (BooleanTopic) topic;
166  }
167
168  /**
169   * Get long topic.
170   *
171   * @param name topic name
172   * @return IntegerTopic
173   */
174  public IntegerTopic getIntegerTopic(String name) {
175    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
176    if (topic instanceof IntegerTopic) {
177      return (IntegerTopic) topic;
178    }
179
180    int handle;
181    if (topic == null) {
182      handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
183    } else {
184      handle = topic.getHandle();
185    }
186
187    topic = new IntegerTopic(this, handle);
188    m_topics.put(name, topic);
189
190    // also cache by handle
191    m_topicsByHandle.put(handle, topic);
192
193    return (IntegerTopic) topic;
194  }

446  }
447
448  private Topic[] topicHandlesToTopics(int[] handles) {
449    Topic[] topics = new Topic[handles.length];
450    for (int i = 0; i < handles.length; i++) {
451      topics[i] = getCachedTopic(handles[i]);
452    }
453    return topics;
454  }
455
456  /**
457   * Get all published topics.
458   *
459   * @return Array of topics.
460   */
461  public Topic[] getTopics() {
462    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, "", 0));
463  }
464
465  /**
466   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
467   * string prefix to only return a subset of all topics.
468   *
469   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
470   *     returned
471   * @return Array of topic information.
472   */
473  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix) {
474    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, prefix, 0));
475  }
476
477  /**
478   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
479   * string prefix and data type to only return a subset of all topics.
480   *
481   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
482   *     returned
483   * @param types bitmask of data types; 0 is treated as a "don't care"
484   * @return Array of topic information.
485   */
486  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix, int types) {
487    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopics(m_handle, prefix, types));
488  }
489
490  /**
491   * Get published topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally filtered by
492   * string prefix and data type to only return a subset of all topics.
493   *
494   * @param prefix topic name required prefix; only topics whose name starts with this string are
495   *     returned
496   * @param types array of data type strings
497   * @return Array of topic information.
498   */
499  public Topic[] getTopics(String prefix, String[] types) {
500    return topicHandlesToTopics(NetworkTablesJNI.getTopicsStr(m_handle, prefix, types));
501  }
502

504   * Get information about all topics.
505   *

508  public TopicInfo[] getTopicInfo() {

510  }

538   * Get information about topics starting with the given prefix. The results are optionally

540   *

546  public TopicInfo[] getTopicInfo(String prefix, String[] types) {

548  }
549
550  /* Cache of created entries. */
551  private final ConcurrentMap<String, NetworkTableEntry> m_entries = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
552
553  /**
554   * Gets the entry for a key.
555   *
556   * @param name Key
557   * @return Network table entry.
558   */
559  public NetworkTableEntry getEntry(String name) {
560    NetworkTableEntry entry = m_entries.get(name);
561    if (entry == null) {
562      entry = new NetworkTableEntry(this, NetworkTablesJNI.getEntry(m_handle, name));
563      NetworkTableEntry oldEntry = m_entries.putIfAbsent(name, entry);
564      if (oldEntry != null) {
565        entry = oldEntry;
566      }
567    }
568    return entry;
569  }
570
571  /* Cache of created topics. */
572  private final ConcurrentMap<String, Topic> m_topics = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
573  private final ConcurrentMap<Integer, Topic> m_topicsByHandle = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
574
575  Topic getCachedTopic(String name) {
576    Topic topic = m_topics.get(name);
577    if (topic == null) {
578      int handle = NetworkTablesJNI.getTopic(m_handle, name);
579      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
580      Topic oldTopic = m_topics.putIfAbsent(name, topic);
581      if (oldTopic != null) {
582        topic = oldTopic;
583      }
584      // also cache by handle
585      m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
586    }
587    return topic;
588  }
589
590  Topic getCachedTopic(int handle) {
591    Topic topic = m_topicsByHandle.get(handle);
592    if (topic == null) {
593      topic = new Topic(this, handle);
594      Topic oldTopic = m_topicsByHandle.putIfAbsent(handle, topic);
595      if (oldTopic != null) {
596        topic = oldTopic;
597      }
598    }
599    return topic;
600  }
601
602  /* Cache of created tables. */
603  private final ConcurrentMap<String, NetworkTable> m_tables = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
604
605  /**
606   * Gets the table with the specified key.
607   *
608   * @param key the key name
609   * @return The network table
610   */
611  public NetworkTable getTable(String key) {
612    // prepend leading / if not present
613    String theKey;
614    if (key.isEmpty() || "/".equals(key)) {
615      theKey = "";
616    } else if (key.charAt(0) == NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR) {
617      theKey = key;
618    } else {
619      theKey = NetworkTable.PATH_SEPARATOR + key;
620    }
621
622    // cache created tables
623    NetworkTable table = m_tables.get(theKey);
624    if (table == null) {
625      table = new NetworkTable(this, theKey);
626      NetworkTable oldTable = m_tables.putIfAbsent(theKey, table);
627      if (oldTable != null) {
628        table = oldTable;
629      }
630    }
631    return table;
632  }
633
634  /*
635   * Callback Creation Functions
636   */
637
638  private static class ListenerStorage implements AutoCloseable {
639    private final ReentrantLock m_lock = new ReentrantLock();
640    private final Map<Integer, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent>> m_listeners = new HashMap<>();
641    private Thread m_thread;
642    private int m_poller;
643    private boolean m_waitQueue;
644    private final Event m_waitQueueEvent = new Event();
645    private final Condition m_waitQueueCond = m_lock.newCondition();
646    private final NetworkTableInstance m_inst;
647
648    ListenerStorage(NetworkTableInstance inst) {
649      m_inst = inst;
650    }
651
652    int add(String[] prefixes, int mask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
653      m_lock.lock();
654      try {
655        if (m_poller == 0) {
656          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
657          startThread();
658        }
659        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addListener(m_poller, prefixes, mask);
660        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
661        return h;
662      } finally {
663        m_lock.unlock();
664      }
665    }
666
667    int add(int handle, int mask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
668      m_lock.lock();
669      try {
670        if (m_poller == 0) {
671          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
672          startThread();
673        }
674        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addListener(m_poller, handle, mask);
675        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
676        return h;
677      } finally {
678        m_lock.unlock();
679      }
680    }
681
682    int addLogger(int minLevel, int maxLevel, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
683      m_lock.lock();
684      try {
685        if (m_poller == 0) {
686          m_poller = NetworkTablesJNI.createListenerPoller(m_inst.getHandle());
687          startThread();
688        }
689        int h = NetworkTablesJNI.addLogger(m_poller, minLevel, maxLevel);
690        m_listeners.put(h, listener);
691        return h;
692      } finally {
693        m_lock.unlock();
694      }
695    }
696
697    void remove(int listener) {
698      m_lock.lock();
699      try {
700        m_listeners.remove(listener);
701      } finally {
702        m_lock.unlock();
703      }
704      NetworkTablesJNI.removeListener(listener);
705    }
706
707    @Override
708    public void close() {
709      if (m_poller != 0) {
710        NetworkTablesJNI.destroyListenerPoller(m_poller);
711      }
712      m_poller = 0;
713    }
714
715    private void startThread() {
716      m_thread =
717          new Thread(
718              () -> {
719                boolean wasInterrupted = false;
720                int[] handles = new int[] { m_poller, m_waitQueueEvent.getHandle() };
721                while (!Thread.interrupted()) {
722                  try {
723                    WPIUtilJNI.waitForObjects(handles);
724                  } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
725                    m_lock.lock();
726                    try {
727                      if (m_waitQueue) {
728                        m_waitQueue = false;
729                        m_waitQueueCond.signalAll();
730                      }
731                    } finally {
732                      m_lock.unlock();
733                    }
734                    Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
735                    // don't try to destroy poller, as its handle is likely no longer valid
736                    wasInterrupted = true;
737                    break;
738                  }
739                  for (NetworkTableEvent event :
740                      NetworkTablesJNI.readListenerQueue(m_inst, m_poller)) {
741                    Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener;
742                    m_lock.lock();
743                    try {
744                      listener = m_listeners.get(event.listener);
745                    } finally {
746                      m_lock.unlock();
747                    }
748                    if (listener != null) {
749                      try {
750                        listener.accept(event);
751                      } catch (Throwable throwable) {
752                        System.err.println(
753                            "Unhandled exception during listener callback: "
754                            + throwable.toString());
755                        throwable.printStackTrace();
756                      }
757                    }
758                  }
759                  m_lock.lock();
760                  try {
761                    if (m_waitQueue) {
762                      m_waitQueue = false;
763                      m_waitQueueCond.signalAll();
764                    }
765                  } finally {
766                    m_lock.unlock();
767                  }
768                }
769                m_lock.lock();
770                try {
771                  if (!wasInterrupted) {
772                    NetworkTablesJNI.destroyListenerPoller(m_poller);
773                  }
774                  m_poller = 0;
775                } finally {
776                  m_lock.unlock();
777                }
778              },
779              "NTListener");
780      m_thread.setDaemon(true);
781      m_thread.start();
782    }
783
784    boolean waitForQueue(double timeout) {
785      m_lock.lock();
786      try {
787        if (m_poller != 0) {
788          m_waitQueue = true;
789          m_waitQueueEvent.set();
790          while (m_waitQueue) {
791            try {
792              if (timeout < 0) {
793                m_waitQueueCond.await();
794              } else {
795                return m_waitQueueCond.await((long) (timeout * 1e9), TimeUnit.NANOSECONDS);
796              }
797            } catch (InterruptedException ex) {
798              Thread.currentThread().interrupt();
799              return true;
800            }
801          }
802        }
803      } finally {
804        m_lock.unlock();
805      }
806      return true;
807    }
808  }
809
810  private ListenerStorage m_listeners = new ListenerStorage(this);
811
812  /**
813   * Remove a connection listener.
814   *
815   * @param listener Listener handle to remove
816   */
817  public void removeListener(int listener) {
818    m_listeners.remove(listener);
819  }
820
821  /**
822   * Wait for the listener queue to be empty. This is primarily useful for deterministic
823   * testing. This blocks until either the listener queue is empty (e.g. there are no
824   * more events that need to be passed along to callbacks or poll queues) or the timeout expires.
825   *
826   * @param timeout timeout, in seconds. Set to 0 for non-blocking behavior, or a negative value to
827   *     block indefinitely
828   * @return False if timed out, otherwise true.
829   */
830  public boolean waitForListenerQueue(double timeout) {
831    return m_listeners.waitForQueue(timeout);
832  }
833
834  /**
835   * Add a connection listener. The callback function is called asynchronously on a separate
836   * thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state
837   * from the callback function.
838   *
839   * @param immediateNotify Notify listener of all existing connections
840   * @param listener Listener to add
841   * @return Listener handle
842   */
843  public int addConnectionListener(
844      boolean immediateNotify, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
845    return m_listeners.add(m_handle,
846        NetworkTableEvent.kConnection | (immediateNotify ? NetworkTableEvent.kImmediate : 0),
847        listener);
848  }
849
850  /**
851   * Add a listener for changes on a particular topic. The callback function is called
852   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
853   * accessing any shared state from the callback function.
854   *
855   * <p>This creates a corresponding internal subscriber with the lifetime of the
856   * listener.
857   *
858   * @param topic Topic
859   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
860   * @param listener Listener function
861   * @return Listener handle
862   */
863  public int addListener(
864      Topic topic, int eventMask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
865    if (topic.getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
866      throw new IllegalArgumentException("topic is not from this instance");
867    }
868    return m_listeners.add(topic.getHandle(), eventMask, listener);
869  }
870
871  /**
872   * Add a listener for changes on a subscriber. The callback function is called
873   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
874   * accessing any shared state from the callback function. This does NOT keep the subscriber
875   * active.
876   *
877   * @param subscriber Subscriber
878   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
879   * @param listener Listener function
880   * @return Listener handle
881   */
882  public int addListener(
883      Subscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
884    if (subscriber.getTopic().getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
885      throw new IllegalArgumentException("subscriber is not from this instance");
886    }
887    return m_listeners.add(subscriber.getHandle(), eventMask, listener);
888  }
889
890  /**
891   * Add a listener for changes on a subscriber. The callback function is called
892   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
893   * accessing any shared state from the callback function. This does NOT keep the subscriber
894   * active.
895   *
896   * @param subscriber Subscriber
897   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
898   * @param listener Listener function
899   * @return Listener handle
900   */
901  public int addListener(
902      MultiSubscriber subscriber, int eventMask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
903    if (subscriber.getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
904      throw new IllegalArgumentException("subscriber is not from this instance");
905    }
906    return m_listeners.add(subscriber.getHandle(), eventMask, listener);
907  }
908
909  /**
910   * Add a listener for changes on an entry. The callback function is called
911   * asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's important to use synchronization or atomics when
912   * accessing any shared state from the callback function.
913   *
914   * @param entry Entry
915   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
916   * @param listener Listener function
917   * @return Listener handle
918   */
919  public int addListener(
920      NetworkTableEntry entry, int eventMask, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
921    if (entry.getTopic().getInstance().getHandle() != m_handle) {
922      throw new IllegalArgumentException("entry is not from this instance");
923    }
924    return m_listeners.add(entry.getHandle(), eventMask, listener);
925  }
926
927  /**
928   * Add a listener for changes to topics with names that start with any of the given
929   * prefixes. The callback function is called asynchronously on a separate thread, so it's
930   * important to use synchronization or atomics when accessing any shared state from the callback
931   * function.
932   *
933   * <p>This creates a corresponding internal subscriber with the lifetime of the
934   * listener.
935   *
936   * @param prefixes Topic name string prefixes
937   * @param eventMask Bitmask of TopicListenerFlags values
938   * @param listener Listener function
939   * @return Listener handle
940   */
941  public int addListener(
942      String[] prefixes,
943      int eventMask,
944      Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> listener) {
945    return m_listeners.add(prefixes, eventMask, listener);
946  }
947
948  /*
949   * Client/Server Functions
950   */
951
952  /**
953   * Get the current network mode.
954   *
955   * @return Bitmask of NetworkMode.
956   */
957  public int getNetworkMode() {
958    return NetworkTablesJNI.getNetworkMode(m_handle);
959  }
960
961  /**
962   * Starts local-only operation. Prevents calls to startServer or startClient from taking effect.
963   * Has no effect if startServer or startClient has already been called.
964   */
965  public void startLocal() {
966    NetworkTablesJNI.startLocal(m_handle);
967  }
968
969  /**
970   * Stops local-only operation. startServer or startClient can be called after this call to start
971   * a server or client.
972   */
973  public void stopLocal() {
974    NetworkTablesJNI.stopLocal(m_handle);
975  }
976
977  /**
978   * Starts a server using the networktables.json as the persistent file, using the default
979   * listening address and port.
980   */
981  public void startServer() {
982    startServer("networktables.json");
983  }
984
985  /**
986   * Starts a server using the specified persistent filename, using the default listening address
987   * and port.
988   *
989   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
990   */
991  public void startServer(String persistFilename) {
992    startServer(persistFilename, "");
993  }
994
995  /**
996   * Starts a server using the specified filename and listening address, using the default port.
997   *
998   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
999   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
1000   */
1001  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress) {
1002    startServer(persistFilename, listenAddress, kDefaultPort3, kDefaultPort4);
1003  }
1004
1005  /**
1006   * Starts a server using the specified filename, listening address, and port.
1007   *
1008   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1009   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
1010   * @param port3 port to communicate over (NT3)
1011   */
1012  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress, int port3) {
1013    startServer(persistFilename, listenAddress, port3, kDefaultPort4);
1014  }
1015
1016  /**
1017   * Starts a server using the specified filename, listening address, and port.
1018   *
1019   * @param persistFilename the name of the persist file to use
1020   * @param listenAddress the address to listen on, or empty to listen on any address
1021   * @param port3 port to communicate over (NT3)
1022   * @param port4 port to communicate over (NT4)
1023   */
1024  public void startServer(String persistFilename, String listenAddress, int port3, int port4) {
1025    NetworkTablesJNI.startServer(m_handle, persistFilename, listenAddress, port3, port4);
1026  }
1027
1028  /** Stops the server if it is running. */
1029  public void stopServer() {
1030    NetworkTablesJNI.stopServer(m_handle);
1031  }
1032
1033  /**
1034   * Starts a NT3 client. Use SetServer or SetServerTeam to set the server name and port.
1035   *
1036   * @param identity network identity to advertise (cannot be empty string)
1037   */
1038  public void startClient3(String identity) {
1039    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient3(m_handle, identity);
1040  }
1041
1042  /**
1043   * Starts a NT4 client. Use SetServer or SetServerTeam to set the server name and port.
1044   *
1045   * @param identity network identity to advertise (cannot be empty string)
1046   */
1047  public void startClient4(String identity) {
1048    NetworkTablesJNI.startClient4(m_handle, identity);
1049  }
1050
1051  /** Stops the client if it is running. */
1052  public void stopClient() {
1053    NetworkTablesJNI.stopClient(m_handle);
1054  }
1055
1056  /**
1057   * Sets server address and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
1058   * default port.
1059   *
1060   * @param serverName server name
1061   */
1062  public void setServer(String serverName) {
1063    setServer(serverName, 0);
1064  }
1065
1066  /**
1067   * Sets server address and port for client (without restarting client).
1068   *
1069   * @param serverName server name
1070   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
1071   */
1072  public void setServer(String serverName, int port) {
1073    NetworkTablesJNI.setServer(m_handle, serverName, port);
1074  }
1075
1076  /**
1077   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
1078   * default port. The client will attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1079   *
1080   * @param serverNames array of server names
1081   */
1082  public void setServer(String[] serverNames) {
1083    setServer(serverNames, 0);
1084  }
1085
1086  /**
1087   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). The client will attempt
1088   * to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1089   *
1090   * @param serverNames array of server names
1091   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
1092   */
1093  public void setServer(String[] serverNames, int port) {
1094    int[] ports = new int[serverNames.length];
1095    for (int i = 0; i < serverNames.length; i++) {
1096      ports[i] = port;
1097    }
1098    setServer(serverNames, ports);
1099  }
1100
1101  /**
1102   * Sets server addresses and ports for client (without restarting client). The client will
1103   * attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1104   *
1105   * @param serverNames array of server names
1106   * @param ports array of port numbers (0=default)
1107   */
1108  public void setServer(String[] serverNames, int[] ports) {
1109    NetworkTablesJNI.setServer(m_handle, serverNames, ports);
1110  }
1111
1112  /**
1113   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Changes the port to the
1114   * default port. The client will attempt to connect to each server in round robin fashion.
1115   *
1116   * @param team team number
1117   */
1118  public void setServerTeam(int team) {
1119    setServerTeam(team, 0);
1120  }
1121
1122  /**
1123   * Sets server addresses and port for client (without restarting client). Connects using commonly
1124   * known robot addresses for the specified team.
1125   *
1126   * @param team team number
1127   * @param port port to communicate over (0=default)
1128   */
1129  public void setServerTeam(int team, int port) {
1130    NetworkTablesJNI.setServerTeam(m_handle, team, port);
1131  }
1132
1133  /**
1134   * Starts requesting server address from Driver Station. This connects to the Driver Station
1135   * running on localhost to obtain the server IP address, and connects with the default port.
1136   */
1137  public void startDSClient() {
1138    startDSClient(0);
1139  }
1140
1141  /**
1142   * Starts requesting server address from Driver Station. This connects to the Driver Station
1143   * running on localhost to obtain the server IP address.
1144   *
1145   * @param port server port to use in combination with IP from DS (0=default)
1146   */
1147  public void startDSClient(int port) {
1148    NetworkTablesJNI.startDSClient(m_handle, port);
1149  }
1150
1151  /** Stops requesting server address from Driver Station. */
1152  public void stopDSClient() {
1153    NetworkTablesJNI.stopDSClient(m_handle);
1154  }
1155
1156  /**
1157   * Flushes all updated values immediately to the local client/server. This does not flush to the
1158   * network.
1159   */
1160  public void flushLocal() {
1161    NetworkTablesJNI.flushLocal(m_handle);
1162  }
1163
1164  /**
1165   * Flushes all updated values immediately to the network. Note: This is rate-limited to protect
1166   * the network from flooding. This is primarily useful for synchronizing network updates with
1167   * user code.
1168   */
1169  public void flush() {
1170    NetworkTablesJNI.flush(m_handle);
1171  }
1172
1173  /**
1174   * Gets information on the currently established network connections. If operating as a client,
1175   * this will return either zero or one values.
1176   *
1177   * @return array of connection information
1178   */
1179  public ConnectionInfo[] getConnections() {
1180    return NetworkTablesJNI.getConnections(m_handle);
1181  }
1182
1183  /**
1184   * Return whether or not the instance is connected to another node.
1185   *
1186   * @return True if connected.
1187   */
1188  public boolean isConnected() {
1189    return NetworkTablesJNI.isConnected(m_handle);
1190  }
1191
1192  /**
1193   * Starts logging entry changes to a DataLog.
1194   *
1195   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopEntryDataLog is called or the
1196   *     instance is destroyed
1197   * @param prefix only store entries with names that start with this prefix; the prefix is not
1198   *     included in the data log entry name
1199   * @param logPrefix prefix to add to data log entry names
1200   * @return Data logger handle
1201   */
1202  public int startEntryDataLog(DataLog log, String prefix, String logPrefix) {
1203    return NetworkTablesJNI.startEntryDataLog(m_handle, log, prefix, logPrefix);
1204  }
1205
1206  /**
1207   * Stops logging entry changes to a DataLog.
1208   *
1209   * @param logger data logger handle
1210   */
1211  public static void stopEntryDataLog(int logger) {
1212    NetworkTablesJNI.stopEntryDataLog(logger);
1213  }
1214
1215  /**
1216   * Starts logging connection changes to a DataLog.
1217   *
1218   * @param log data log object; lifetime must extend until StopConnectionDataLog is called or the
1219   *     instance is destroyed
1220   * @param name data log entry name
1221   * @return Data logger handle
1222   */
1223  public int startConnectionDataLog(DataLog log, String name) {
1224    return NetworkTablesJNI.startConnectionDataLog(m_handle, log, name);
1225  }
1226
1227  /**
1228   * Stops logging connection changes to a DataLog.
1229   *
1230   * @param logger data logger handle
1231   */
1232  public static void stopConnectionDataLog(int logger) {
1233    NetworkTablesJNI.stopConnectionDataLog(logger);
1234  }
1235
1236  /**
1237   * Add logger callback function. By default, log messages are sent to stderr; this function sends
1238   * log messages with the specified levels to the provided callback function instead. The callback
1239   * function will only be called for log messages with level greater than or equal to minLevel and
1240   * less than or equal to maxLevel; messages outside this range will be silently ignored.
1241   *
1242   * @param minLevel minimum log level
1243   * @param maxLevel maximum log level
1244   * @param func callback function
1245   * @return Listener handle
1246   */
1247  public int addLogger(int minLevel, int maxLevel, Consumer<NetworkTableEvent> func) {
1248    return m_listeners.addLogger(minLevel, maxLevel, func);
1249  }
1250
1251  @Override
1252  public boolean equals(Object other) {
1253    if (other == this) {
1254      return true;
1255    }
1256    if (!(other instanceof NetworkTableInstance)) {
1257      return false;
1258    }
1259
1260    return m_handle == ((NetworkTableInstance) other).m_handle;
1261  }
1262
1263  @Override
1264  public int hashCode() {
1265    return m_handle;
1266  }
1267
1268  private boolean m_owned;
1269  private final int m_handle;
1270}
